Text: Praise the LORD. I will give thanks to the LORD with all my heart in the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
Context: The Psalmist expresses his intention to wholeheartedly praise God in community settings, both informal and formal.

Text: Great are the works of the LORD; they are pondered by all who delight in them.
Context: Reflection on the awe-inspiring acts of God, which draws the attention and contemplation of those who take joy in His deeds.

Text: Glorious and majestic are His deeds, and His righteousness endures forever.
Context: Admiration for the God’s deeds which are both glorious and majestic; His righteousness is unending.

Text: He has caused His wonders to be remembered; the LORD is gracious and compassionate.
Context: The Psalmist acknowledges God‘s providing a way for His wondrous works to be remembered, underscoring God’s grace and compassion.

Text: He provides food for those who fear Him; He remembers His covenant forever.
Context: Recognition of God‘s provision to those who revere Him, and His everlasting remembrance of His covenant.

Text: He has shown His people the power of His works by giving them the inheritance of the nations.
Context: Justifying the pride His people can take in their God who has demonstrated His power and granted them a heritage among the nations.

Text: The works of His hands are truth and justice; all His precepts are trustworthy.
Context: Expressing trust in God whose works embody truth and justice, and whose commands can be relied upon.

Text: They are upheld forever and ever, enacted in faithfulness and uprightness.
Context: Assurance for believers that God’s precepts are eternal and are enacted with faithfulness and integrity.

Text: He has sent redemption to His people; He has ordained His covenant forever— holy and awesome is His name.
Context: An expression of deep respect for God who has provided redemption and established an eternal covenant; His name is sacred and formidable.

Text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow His precepts have good understanding. To Him belongs eternal praise.
Context: Asserting that true wisdom starts with reverence for God, and those who follow His commands will gain understanding, affirming that God is worthy of unending praise.
